definition: Framed in terms of a random process giving rise to an outcome. The probability of an outcome is the proportion of times the outcome would occur if we observed the random process an infinite number of times.
citation: Diez, D.; C _ etinkaya-Rundel, M.; Barr, C.D. (2019) OpenIntro Statistics. 4th Ed.,

definition: As more observations are collected, the proportion of occurances with a particulat outcome convergest to the probability p of that outcome.
citation: Diez, D.; C _ etinkaya-Rundel, M.; Barr, C.D. (2019) OpenIntro Statistics. 4th Ed.,
